OpenAPI 3.1.1 Specificationcyber.trackr.live API

OpenAPI specification driving a complete client ecosystem for cybersecurity compliance data

Explore OpenAPI Spec
Get Started
API Reference
📋

OpenAPI 3.1.1 Specification

Production-ready specification with 15+ endpoints covering 1000+ DISA STIGs, 300+ SRGs, and 3000+ CCIs. Complete validation and standards compliance.

💎

Client Ecosystem

Ruby client (production-ready) with TypeScript, Python, and Go clients planned. All generated from the same OpenAPI specification.

📚

Interactive Documentation

Try-it-out functionality that works on GitHub Pages through our CORS proxy solution. Always up-to-date with the specification.

🤝

Official Partnership

Collaborative project with cyber.trackr.live - we provide the OpenAPI specification and client ecosystem for their API service.

🔧

OpenAPI-First Development

Two-tier testing, specification-driven development, and cross-platform patterns applicable to any OpenAPI project.

🌐

Cybersecurity Data Access

No authentication required - immediate access to comprehensive DISA compliance data and 87 SCAP documents.

OpenAPI Specification Partnership ​

Our OpenAPI 3.1.1 specification provides the foundation for accessing cyber.trackr.live API data. Learn more about our partnership and how the specification drives the entire client ecosystem.

Getting Started ​

Choose your path to explore the OpenAPI specification and client ecosystem:

Primary Paths ​

  1. OpenAPI Specification - Explore the core project and specification details
  2. Installation Guide - Set up the Ruby client or development environment
  3. API Reference - Interactive documentation with try-it-out functionality
  4. Client Generation - Generate clients in TypeScript, Python, Go, and other languages

Why OpenAPI-First Matters ​

Our specification-driven approach provides:

  • Single source of truth - All clients and documentation generated from the OpenAPI spec
  • Consistent implementations - Same behavior across Ruby, TypeScript, Python, Go clients
  • Always up-to-date documentation - Interactive docs generated from the specification
  • Professional validation - Spectral linting ensures specification quality

Learn more about OpenAPI-first development and how it solves common API challenges.

Quick Access ​

  • OpenAPI Specification - Core project and specification details
  • Installation Guide - Set up Ruby client or development environment
  • API Reference - Interactive documentation with try-it-out
  • Development Patterns - Architecture and testing approaches
  • Project Information - Contributing, security, and governance

Community & Support ​

  • 📚 Documentation: Comprehensive guides throughout this site
  • 🐛 Issues: GitHub Issues for bugs and features
  • 💬 Discussions: GitHub Discussions for questions
  • 🏢 MITRE: Created and maintained by MITRE Corporation

The OpenAPI 3.1.1 specification is the foundation that drives everything else. Explore the specification to understand how it powers the entire ecosystem.
